title: No mana potions feels horrible
body: feels like some champions aren't even viable anymore, forget wave clear if your an Olaf or most champions for that matter now, even with the mana regen "buffs" doesn't feel like anything if you use most of your mana wave clearing the first few levels, say goodbye to any sort of lane control

but it still makes for uninteractive laning vs some champs. for example, i was nasus vs. a yorick. I was his complete bitch to do with what he wanted for the first 15 min of the game. They were only stacks to me. i hit 450 stacks at 20min, a personal best. Before i could even exert my influence the enemy /ff at about 23min, 600 stacks deep.

You: I pick Nasus. If you let me farm for 20minutes I become extremely strong, and I take over the game.
STUPID CHAMPS THAT CAN SHUT ME DOWN AND DON'T LET ME FARM FOR 20 MINUTES FOR FREE TO BECOME A MONSTER. DELETE THEM. DELETE!!!

If you don't, I have an answer. Don't reply.
I mean, there are still those new Refillable Pots, you just have to invest a bit more money in them. Which I think is fair, because it feels terrible trying to run through a persons pot collection,

You have to drop a whole 400 gold to get the corrupting potion, which even after all three charges only offers the equivalent of 1.5 mana pots.

The Hunters potion is *far* superior because of the refill on jungle clearing, but corrupting potion is so pathetic it hurts. It gives almost no sustain, completely unnoticeable damage, and locks you out of actual health pots.

I'm ok with them wanting to cut back the strength of starting infinite sustain with flask+Pots, but since pots and refillable are mutually exclusive, they need to buff the Refillables so that they are actually useable. At least make it comparable to the old Crystaline flask and give 120 HP and 60 mana again.
Not to mention the 'burn' is about as effective as old Spirit of the Elder Lizard or current {{item:2139}} (of which are like, 10-50 damage... against things that have **thousands** of health...)

Well, to be fair, it was Yasuo, who got indirectly buffed and was already a decent counter to Galio.

Check the new elixirs in terms of mana regen - keeping in mind that old mana potions regenerated 100 mana at the cost of 35 gold and could be stacked up to 5 AND that no laner is supposed to build the jungler elixir (which regenerates the most mana)

Using elixirs for mana is RIDICULOUSLY inefficient in terms of slot efficency and gold efficiency.

And try conserving mana against a resourceless champions which are ridiculously spammy and popular now.

And mana "buffs" were just +50 base mana (which is half of a skill on most champions) in exchange for -50 mana at level 18 (so not actually a buff just a change)
It's funny you mention 50 mana as being half a skill on most champions because the same is said for 100 mana, it was generally a dead end for your gold.
100 mana is the cost of a blitz grab - potentially lane winning, and you're skipping the important part - mana potions could be stacked (so essentialy a banked 500 mana)

If you are chugging down 5 mana potions you have a major problem with how you lane, and riot shouldn't balance around people playing like a monkey.

Conserving mana and actually using abilities when it is needed IS A THING.

Using auto attacks to farm in balance with wave clear IS A THING

Carefully using abilities to there utmost effectiveness to not need to use them as much IS A THING

Mana potions are encouraging people playing like idiots and disallow proper mana gating, there removal will be forgotten about in a month when people adjust and realize they didn't need them nearly as much as they thought they did.

Why yes, people should be gated with how free they use their abilities...

Which is the main problem with resourceless champions, mana based champions were already gated as they had to spend GOLD on MANA POTIONS to keep up with the spam that resourceless champions can dish out.

I'd have no problems without mana potions if they introduced an alternative, instead of the band aid fix of "you get 50 max mana a bit earlier now". Masteries are awful in that respect as well.

I really don't understand how heavy mana use mages are supposed to compete now with zed, yas, akali, & kat in mid lane???? They lost nothing, yet I have lost all ability sustain an attack mode in lane (or roaming in some cases). I have played against a manaless enemy laner (mid) in every game since the patch...obviously there is a problem.

I main diana and one full combo at lvl 6 pretty much empties her mana, however one combo isn't enough to kill any decent player. Which means I can't follow with another combo.....which is the entire point of her skill set!!!! If I can't follow up, I can't finish. Is the jungler supposed to give up the blue every time now? 

Any supposed buff to base mana or dorans appears to be worthless early/mid game. I realize that we now have to rush mana regen items...but many times that sacrifices ability power. So my choice is to stack killing power, but not have enough mana to use it....or stack mana regen, but not have enough killing power to do anything. 

Maybe my build/play style was too mana heavy...but that was my choice to make and I felt the gold trade off was always worth it if I could kill. 

And the new refillable pots are worthless for those of us that need the mana side of it. Waste of money. **Really disappointing change Rito.**
